issue_obverse_figure_s: Right profile of Narseh on frontal bust
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: arcaded crown surmounted by three floral elements; covered korymbos; plain diadem, diadem ribbons pointing upwards; earing consisting of two elements; neck-line of tunica edged with row of pearls; double lines running the shoulders to the breast ornament (the latter not visible); dotted border
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: base consisting of two elements; square altar shaft; four altar slabs; altar flames depicted with vertical lines; to the left of the altar attendant with stylized crown of Narseh, holding a barsom in his right hand, to the right of the altar attendant with stylized crown of Ahuramazda, holding a barsom with his left hand, both facing inwards; dotted border; to the left of the later flames symbol (SNS, var. 25), to the right symbol (SNS 3, var. 48)
issue_reverse_legend_s: 3 h l.i. NWRA ZY, 9 h l. o. nrshy| ādur ī Nārseh | “the fire of Narseh” (partly retrograde)
